alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Haskell and western Throckmorton Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1044 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Weinert, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haskell, Stamford, Weinert, Irby, Millers Creek Reservoir, Us- 183 Near The Throckmorton-Baylor County Line, Us- 277 Near The Haskell-Knox County Line and The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
